titles: A treatise of the arms and engines of vvar of fire-works, ensigns, and military instruments, both ancient and modern; with the manner they are at present used, as well in French armies, as amongst other nations. Inriched with many figures. Written originally in French by Lewis de Gaya, author of the treatise called The art of war. Translated for publick advantage.
author: Gaya, Louis de.
publisher: printed for Robert Hartford, at the sign of the Angel in Corn-hill, near the Royal Exchange,
notes: Includes table of contents and a final page of advertisement.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford.
keywords: Military art and science --  Early works to 1800.
